page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF LANDSCAPE
page.content:
GENERAL DESCRIPTION
The area in this block is a landscape broken up by river valleys,between rolling hills.Heights range from near sea level to around 200 metres.It is predominantly farmland, and is a landscape typical of rural DEVON with a number of scattered farms and one nucleated village at Ideford.There is a long history of settlement in this area,and many of the buildings are 300-400 years old,although more modern housing in Ideford has been constructed since 1945.Much of the area is under pasture for Sheep,and Dairy and Beef Cattle,but arable land is also found producing cereals and fodder crops.Unlike some regions this farmong area hasretained its traditional hedges,giving character.
